results.title: Aerial attack on grass fires
results.brief_description: A trial demonstration was arranged at Orange, N.S.W., in which a Cessna plane carrying 75 gallons of water was used to find out what part light aircraft can play in fighting grass fires. Although the test was inconclusive it did show that a small plane would be of no use on a day of extreme fire danger.
results.description: A trial demonstration was arranged at Orange, N.S.W., in which a Cessna plane carrying 75 gallons of water was used to find out what part light aircraft can play in fighting grass fires. Although the test was inconclusive it did show that a small plane would be of no use on a day of extreme fire danger.

results.title: Aeradio: the pilot's link to the ground
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Department of the Interior and John Martin-Jones
results.brief_description: An insight into the work of the Communications Officers - the men who keep a constant radio check on all aircraft in the air, maintaining voice or morse contact with the pilots, supplying information on weather conditions ahead, giving position, and acting, generally, as the pilot’s agent on the ground.

results.title: Advertising
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Explores the structure of an advertising agency, looking at the roles of account executives, researchers, commercial artists, copywriters, photographers, production and media planners. By following the process of an advertising campaign, the skills and collaboration required within each section of an agency are highlighted.

results.title: Adventuring in conservation
results.creator_credit: Indiana University and American Camping Association
results.brief_description: Shows boys and girls as they discover the interdependence of plants and animals in nature’s communities. How man destroys or upsets these communities; the importance of natural resources and what we can do to conserve them; camping practices which will help conserve natural resources.

results.brief_description: Designed for use in primary classes, this film illustrates the habits and characteristics of goats, and shows typical scenes of farm life. Tells of the adventures of twin goats when they set out to explore a large pasture for the first time.

results.title: Adventures of Jimmy
results.brief_description: A picturesque account of the search of a particularly naive young man for his ideal mate in the big city (San Francisco) and his rather overwhelming success at the film’s conclusion. Though told with tongue in cheek, it has a lot to say about loneliness in a busy world. Stylistically, “Adventures of Jimmy” takes a not undeserved poke at those psychoanalytical literary travelogues so popular in the 1950’s featuring the neurotic as hero. Mr Broughton reads the commentary while Weldon Kees, himself a poet and painter, arranged and plays the musical accompaniment. Written by James Broughton. Photography by Frank Stauffacher.
